item.title: Colin Pitchfork: Double child murderer released from prison
item.description: Colin Pitchfork was jailed in 1988 for raping and murdering two 15-year-old girls in Leicestershire.

item.title: Westminster double murder: Lee Peacock appears at Old Bailey
item.description: Sharon Pickles and Clinton Ashmore were both fatally stabbed in central London in August.

item.title: Benjamin Mendy: Manchester City player to remain in custody on rape charges
item.description: Defender Benjamin Mendy, who has been charged with rape, has a bail application refused by a judge.

item.title: Tributes to motocross rider Jude Morris killed at race event
item.description: Jude Morris, from Corfe Castle, was described as one of the sport's brightest young talents.

item.title: Marble Arch Mound: Attraction to stay permanently free
item.description: The manmade hill and viewing platform has struggled to attract paying visitors or rave reviews.

item.title: Car still embedded in Peterborough house a week after crash
item.description: Vigie Hammond says the car is still embedded in her house a week later.

item.title: Syed Taalay Ahmed: Hartlepool journalist killed in Ghana armed robbery
item.description: The 31-year-old from Hartlepool was making a documentary in Africa for a Muslim television network.

item.title: Aya Hachem: Blackburn award to honour woman shot in drive-by
item.description: An award honouring Blackburn's young person of the year is renamed as a "lasting tribute" to Aya Hachem.

item.title: Colchester and Ipswich hospitals say shortages due to midwives retiring
item.description: Health watchdog inspectors demanded improvements after finding staff shortages at two hospitals.

item.title: Manchester ovarian cancer survivor pushes for more research
item.description: A woman who has recovered from a rare form of ovarian cancer is campaigning for further research into the disease.

item.title: Family of ducks waddles through University of Nottingham library
item.description: The mother and her ducklings were "calm and unflustered" as they walked around George Green Library.

item.title: Childcare costs: London parents call for review
item.description: Childcare costs are 30% higher in inner London than the national average, a study found.

item.title: Football fan credits daughter with changing his racist beliefs
item.description: Football fan Neil says he changed his attitude with the help of his daughter, Millie.

item.title: Dave Grohl performs with Nandi Bushell, 11, at Foo Fighters gig
item.description: Nandi Bushell joins the American rock band on stage in Los Angeles.

item.title: Feminist Collages London: Tackling violence against women with slogan posters
item.description: A movement that started in Paris, has now spread into locations across the globe.

item.title: Why teenagers are mentoring senior Met Police officers
item.description: Three teenagers have mentored a trio of the Metâ€™s top women officers over the last six months.

item.title: Child abuse investigations: Met Police warned it could be putting children in danger
item.description: The force does not identify at-risk children quickly enough in its investigations, a report finds.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: Boccia player David Smith retains individual title with thrilling victory
item.description: Britain's David Smith retains his Paralympic boccia individual title with a thrilling victory in Tokyo in the BC1 final.

item.title: Joe Root: England captain returns to top of Test batting rankings
item.description: England captain Joe Root returnes to the top of the ICC's Test batting rankings for the first time in six years.

item.title: US Open 2021: Emma Raducanu wins on New York main-draw debut
item.description: British teenager Emma Raducanu again shows her talent and maturity on the Grand Slam stage as she eases to victory on her US Open main-draw debut.
